editorialSummary.text: Airy quarters in a sleek hotel featuring a restaurant/bar, a 24-hour gym & free Wi-Fi.

originalText.text:
My recent stay at was nothing short of exceptional, leaving me with lasting impressions of comfort, service, and tranquility.

From the moment I entered the lobby, I was greeted by a warm and inviting atmosphere. The check-in process was seamless, and the staff displayed a level of hospitality that set the tone for the entire stay.

The room exceeded expectations, boasting modern amenities and tasteful decor. The attention to detail was evident, from the plush bedding to the well-appointed bathroom. Cleanliness was a standout feature, reflecting the hotel's commitment to maintaining a high standard of hygiene.

One of the highlights of my stay was the impeccable service. The hotel staff went above and beyond to ensure a pleasant experience, from providing local recommendations to promptly addressing any inquiries or requests. Their dedication to guest satisfaction truly stood out.

The location was also noteworthy, conveniently situated making it easy to explore the local attractions and landmarks.

In summary, exceeded my expectations in every aspect. If you're seeking a refined and comfortable retreat with exceptional service, this hotel is a prime choice. My stay was a perfect blend of luxury, convenience, and genuine hospitality, leaving me eager to return in the future.

originalText.text: Stayed here for 6 days for a work trip and would not stay again. While the staff was generally friendly and responsive, I showed up to a syringe in my room (medical, not elicit) which they just kind of laughed off. The pillows had feathers poking through, and the refrigerator froze about $100 worth of food (even the stuff in the door) to which The front desk replied "that sucks". The security card system in the elevator only mostly worked, and the walls were pretty thin. Overall the location was all right as it was right next to my work building and a few good bars/restaurants, but I would probably stay somewhere else for my next conference.

originalText.text:
I’ve stayed at this hotel before and had no issues, this was right before the pandemic. I went back this past weekend and had a bad experience. I checked in and they made me swipe my card twice, not sure why…. But they charge my card 3 times, they charged me $1900 USD when my reservation was only $407.55

They charged me the wrong rate TWICE and on top they charged me $100/night for security deposit so that was $300, but their website stated their deposit is $25/night max. I am a Titanium and have never been charged this much for a security deposit let alone been charged $1900 for a reservation of $407.55 it is Wednesday right now and they have yet to refund me the money they overcharged me… on top of that they kept lying over and over throughout the night I checked in, so I will be reaching out to corporate as I have their emails, I made them aware of this and they called my room within seconds after I sent them the email addresses of their executives whom I plan to reach out to.

All in all this left a bad taste in my mouth, imagine if you had gone to NYC with a budget and this hotel decides to charge you thousands 4x your reservation. Avoid this hotel if you want to avoid them overcharging you.

originalText.text: The room, pillows, bathroom, television, and staff were all top draw as one would expect at a Marriott property. The coffee in the room along with creamer and sugar was sub-par like a cheap hotel. The check-in staff was extremely helpful. I recommend shying away from the hotel's restaurant if you desire a coffee and Danish in the morning leave the hotel take a left and enjoy the Old Country Coffee shop 25 paces away from the hotel. Dinner should be taken somewhere else.

Dinner should be taken somewhere else.

originalText.text:
My executive stayed there from 12/10 - 12/12. He found the mattress smell funny the first night and had mentioned it to the front desk clerk in the morning, that something is wrong w/ the mattress.
When he returned in the afternoon, he pulled back the sheet to find urine on the top left corner (near the pillow) soaked. He went downstairs to advise the front desk, where they could not move his room as they were sold out as well as other hotels in the area being unavailable, they offered him an air mattress. Which was not a resolve. They insinuated that he must have done it with the type of questions being asked. This has been under investigation for over a week, for urine!!!! What type of investigation is being done??? They have...  The worst customer care!
My executive called on 12/12 to dispute the charges due to the urine soaked bed. He slept on the tiny couch in the room. This is the worst experience he's ever encountered. No empathy for his situation. No resolve for his inconvenience. I would never pay to stay in a hotel that had urine on the bed.
We disputed this issue on 12/12, I followed up on 12/13 and was told we would receive an email within 48 hrs with a resolution. I have worked in hotels, and this is something that can be handled quickly and professionally. Instead they behave as if the person who complained urinated in the bed by asking questions that seem accusatory!
We will not be using this service for our organization moving forward since they do not know how to provide outstanding customer care.
Edit: My manager noted that an email was sent re: the case, being resolved but no detail on how it was resolved.
